prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Central Cylindrical Hole The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a central cylindrical hole that is slightly larger than the prism's width. The prism is positioned at an angle with the hole facing upwards. The height, width, and length of the prism are 0.75, 0.75, and 0.0165 units respectively. The cylindrical hole has the same width as the prism, i.e., 0.75 units. Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin, with Euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] units. This alignment will serve as the base for the 2D sketch of the part. Step 2: Create the 2D Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should include 10 lines and 2 arcs, as described in the sequence below: 1. Line 1: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.51, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Draw a line from point [0.51, 0.0] to point [0.51, 0.57]. 3. Line 3: Draw a line from point [0.51, 0.57] to point [0.51, 0.75]. 4. Line 4: Draw a line from point [0.51, 0.75] to point [0.33, 0.75]. 5. Line 5: Draw a line from point [0.33, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. 6. Line 6: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.321]. 7. Line 7: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.321] to point [0.135, 0.321]. 8. Arc 1: Draw an arc from point [0.135, 0.321] with a radius of 0.1069 units to point [0.255, 0.201]. 9. Line 8: Draw a line from point [0.255, 0.201] to point [0.255, 0.195]. 10. Arc 2: Draw an arc from point [0.255, 0.195] with a radius of 0.1069 units to point [0.135, 0.075]. 11. Line 9: Draw a line from point [0.135, 0.075] to point [0.0, 0.075]. 12. Line 10: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.075] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Ensure that the loop is closed; meaning, the start and end points of the loop should be connected. Step 3: Transform the 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the defined euler angles and translation vector present in the coordinate system. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.0165 units (towards the normal) to create the final 3D model for the first part.</description>
